chargeHist.descr: Cause Injury while Operating with PAC
Injury by Use of Vehicle with PAC

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth H Barnhardt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Injury by Intoxicated Use/Vehicle, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.25(1)(a).
  • Injury by Use of Vehicle with PAC, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.25(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant, Kenneth H Barnhardt, in custody, appeared with Attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore.  Prosecuting attorney Aaron Olson.  Defendant in custody.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(1:41)
Olson - addresses the court
K. B. - (victim) addresses the court - requests 5 yrs prison, would like him to be on probation too
D. G. (victims mother) addresses the court
Olson - 5 yrs IC - 7 yrs ES not eligible for earned release & chall incar. - $2205.90 rest, $268 cc
Larimore - have some of deft's family here to speak
H.B. (deft's sister) addresses the court
Larimore addresses sentencing - asks the court to consider deft's action in getting help for victim - requests 6 month sentence considering his health and age, is not receiving social security due to him being incarcerated and not receiving health care.
Deft addresses the court
Court questions deft
All parties stipulate to credit time 123 days
Court questions victim

COURT:  Ct 3 & 4 merged for penalty
w/held sent 7 yrs probation
CC - $268
  CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
1 yr jail - forthwith - huber for work & treatment
Restitution - $2205.90
no alcohol
assessment
would like deft to do 12 step program - not ordering it - according to agent
credit 123 days if revoked
restorative justice if can be set up
$500 CASH BOND APPLIES

Defendant, Kenneth H Barnhardt with Attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Aaron Olson.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
